title: Liverpool vs Arsenal: Jurgen Klopp reveals he did not expect Curtis Jones to take last penalty in Carabao Cup shootout win over Arsenal
text:
Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp admitted it was not his decision for Curtis Jones to take Liverpool’s final penalty in his side’s shootout win over Arsenal at Anfield.

The round of 16 tie brought about another League Cup classic as Klopp’s men drew 5-5 with Unai Emery’s side, who were in the lead for the majority of the match before Divock Origi added a 94th minute equaliser.

Dani Ceballos was the unfortunate player to miss his spot kick, and it was a decisive miss as Jones stepped up to score the winning penalty in front of the Kop, even if it was a decision his manager was not aware of.

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

“It was not my decision in the end for him [Jones] to take the last penalty,” Klopp said.

“When I saw the list Origi was the taker of the last one and they changed it obviously.

“If you don’t win nobody remembers it in three years, if it works out the boys will remember it forever.”

The night saw both teams’ defensive deficiencies exposed, and while Klopp admitted that mistakes had been made he was grateful that his side ended on the winning side on another memorable night at Anfield.

“We made some mistakes, we played some average passes. We were too open at times.

“We can talk about tactics but who cares on a night like this? I hoped for the boys they would have a game to remember.

“What they did tonight, I lost it really. It’s like a dream to play for the first time at Anfield, but things might not be going right and you have to stay on track. All our goals we scored were wonderful.

“Kelleher is an outstanding talent. The crossing from Williams, he might not have thought he would play tonight.”
description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp admitted it was not his decision for Curtis Jones to take Liverpool’s final penalty in his side’s shootout win over Arsenal at Anfield. The round of 16 tie brought about another League Cup classic as Klopp’s men drew 5-5 with Unai Emery’s side, who were in the lead for the majority of the match before Divock Origi added a 94th minute equaliser.
